content:
December 15, 1954
I was born in a small town in the midwestern.
My parents named me Robert.

June 12, 1966
My parents and I moved to a new town, where I met my best friend, and won my first soccer game.

September 1, 1972
I started my first year of college, majoring in chemistry.

May 20, 1976
I graduated from college with a honor degree.
I was proud of my accomplishment and excited to start my career.

November 2, 1979
I got married to my college sweetheart, Emma.
I'm so lucky to have her in my life.

August 7, 1982
Emma and I moved to a new city for a better opportunity.
We're able to buy our own house.

June 15, 1983
My wife and I welcomed our first child, a son whom we named Michael.
 Becoming a father was one of the happiest moments of my life.

June 18, 2005
My wife and I became empty-nesters, 
when our son graduated from college and moved to another state to pursue his career.

April 3, 2010
I became a grandfather.
It was a joyous moment that made me feel proud and happy.

June 25, 2019
My wife and I celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary.
We were grateful for each other's company and for the wonderful life we had built together.
We made a promise to love each other, forever.
